variants.description_in_input: Identified in patients with Dyskeratosis Congenita, causing partial loss of function and reduced telomere length.
Identified in patients with Dyskeratosis Congenita, causing partial loss of function and reduced telomere length.

material_used.name: Patient samples
material_used.description: Whole-exome sequencing was performed on patient samples to identify variants in the TERC gene.

readout_description.result_description: Variant identified in patients with Dyskeratosis Congenita.
Variant identified in patients with Dyskeratosis Congenita.

material_used.name: HEK293 cells
material_used.description: HEK293 cells expressing the TERC variants or control plasmids were used for functional assays.

readout_description.result_description: Telomere length reduced by 20% compared to controls (p < 0.01).
Telomere length reduced by 18% compared to controls (p < 0.01).

experiment_methods.basic_positive_control_description: Control plasmids were used as positive controls.
experiment_methods.basic_negative_control_description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.

material_used.name: HEK293 cells
material_used.description: HEK293 cells expressing the TERC variants or control plasmids were used for cell viability assays.

readout_description.result_description: Cell viability at 65% compared to 85% in controls (p < 0.05).
Cell viability at 63% compared to 85% in controls (p < 0.05).

experiment_methods.basic_positive_control_description: Control plasmids were used as positive controls.
experiment_methods.basic_negative_control_description: Empty vector was used as a negative control.
